input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Obesity has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Smoking has a direct effect on diabetes and lifespan. Diabetes has a direct effect on lifespan. Smoking is unobserved. The overall probability of obesity is 8%. The probability of normal weight and long lifespan is 63%. The probability of obesity and long lifespan is 3%. Is the chance of long lifespan smaller when observing obesity?
